summary: You are in the Engineering room, surrounded by maroon piping and the echoes of grinding wheels.
detail: As you step into the dimly lit Engineering room, you can't help but marvel at the level of mechanical chaos on display: maroon pipelines crisscross the low ceiling, hissing with steam, while a shockingly large grinding wheel whirs softly nearby--too close for comfort. Amidst the odd array of antiquated and untrustworthy mechanisms, you notice a console adorned with buttons and dials, as well as a space-safe cleverly hidden behind a rusted pipe.

expression.content: Upon closer inspection, you notice that the console seems strangely intuitive, despite its retro aesthetic. A blinking screen prompts you to enter a code, and you can't help but feel that doing so might unlock something rather important.

The space-safe, seemingly built into the wall and almost hidden by the rusty pipes, has a small display demanding a proper keycode. You can't help but suspect that it might be linked to the mysterious console, and perhaps even the fate of this derelict vessel.

As you enter the Space KeyCode into the console, the mechanical cacophony subsides, revealing an odd sense of calm. Your actions seem to have unlocked the space-safe, which slowly swings open to reveal a hidden treasure: a stash of cheese-flavoured crackers, rendering dinner plans inevitably more tolerable.

Suddenly, you feel a profound shift in the air. Could it be? Yes! It appears as though the Curry Wizard has broken free from the Bubble Bath's clutches, proving that miracles really do happen, even on derelict space vessels amidst pulsing maroon pipes and cheese-flavoured crackers.
